result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D Rounds

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy D Rounds appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Jeremy D Rounds.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel recently appointed and has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy D Rounds appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. 
Case scheduled for pretrial conference. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/28/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Jeremy D Rounds in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/26/22 @ 2p
